com.mapbox.services.android.telemetry.backoff

Class ExponentialBackoff

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.services.android.telemetry.backoff.ExponentialBackoff

  • public class ExponentialBackoff
extends Object
    Simplified version of Google HTTP Client Library for Java's ExponentialBackOff. https://developers.google.com/api-client-library/java/google-http-java-client/backoff In this version, the interval creation is deterministic and has no concept of maxElapsedTimeMillis, it's up to the application to stop. It also adjusts its default values.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_INITIAL_INTERVAL_MILLIS
      The default initial interval value in milliseconds (10 seconds).
      static int DEFAULT_MAX_INTERVAL_MILLIS
      The default maximum back off time in milliseconds (10 minutes).
      static double DEFAULT_MULTIPLIER
      The default multiplier value (2.0 which is 100% increase per back off).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExponentialBackoff() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCurrentIntervalMillis()
      Returns the current retry interval in milliseconds.
      long getElapsedTimeMillis()
      Returns the elapsed time in milliseconds since an ExponentialBackoff instance is created and is reset when reset() is called.
      int getInitialIntervalMillis()
      Returns the initial retry interval in milliseconds.
      int getMaxIntervalMillis()
      Returns the maximum value of the back off period in milliseconds.
      double getMultiplier()
      Returns the value to multiply the current interval with for each retry attempt.
      long nextBackOffMillis()
      Get the next back off interval
      void reset()
      Sets the interval back to the initial retry interval and restarts the timer.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public final void reset()
        Sets the interval back to the initial retry interval and restarts the timer.

      • nextBackOffMillis

        public long nextBackOffMillis()
        Get the next back off interval

      • getInitialIntervalMillis

        public final int getInitialIntervalMillis()
        Returns the initial retry interval in milliseconds.

      • getCurrentIntervalMillis

        public final int getCurrentIntervalMillis()
        Returns the current retry interval in milliseconds.

      • getMultiplier

        public final double getMultiplier()
        Returns the value to multiply the current interval with for each retry attempt.

      • getMaxIntervalMillis

        public final int getMaxIntervalMillis()
        Returns the maximum value of the back off period in milliseconds. Once the current interval reaches this value it stops increasing.

      • getElapsedTimeMillis

        public final long getElapsedTimeMillis()
        Returns the elapsed time in milliseconds since an ExponentialBackoff instance is created and is reset when reset() is called.

        The elapsed time is computed using System.nanoTime().
